resources.string: Baba Marta is an ancient Bulgarian tradition celebrating the end of winter. The legend represents the month of March as an old lady with warm and at the same time grumpy temper, reflecting the weather at this time of the year.

Few weeks before the 1st of March, on the streets of all towns and villages, merchants start selling the traditional charms, made of red and white woolen threads, coming in all shapes and forms.They are called "Martenitsa".

People of all ages buy or make ‘matrtenitsa’s and give them as a gift to their family and friends with wishes for good health. It is said that you have to wear them until you see the first storks coming back from the south.
